main event: Two separate UFO sightings occurred in Truk Atoll, Pacific Ocean in February 1953. The first sighting involved an Air Force officer observing a bullet-shaped shiny object, and the second sighting involved a Japanese fishing boat crew witnessing a bright circular light emitting a reddish-orange glow.
interesting points: The first sighting described a bullet-shaped shiny object traveling at an estimated 150 mph with no trail, smoke, or tail indication.
The object was slightly larger than a C-47 aircraft and appeared to be of metallic construction.
The second sighting involved a bright circular light emitting a bright reddish-orange glow that moved rapidly across the sky for approximately 30 seconds.
The fishing crew reported feeling very frightened by the object and hurriedly began retrieving their fishing gear after the sighting.
A detailed report of the fishing boat incident was forwarded to the headquarters of the United States Air Force in Washington, D.C., for evaluation and analysis.
sighted object: bullet-shaped shiny object and a bright circular light
witnesses: Air Force officer, Japanese fishing boat crew
